column4: what is the main difference between the "noobfriendly distros" (such as k-/ubuntu, suse, fedora...) besides that they use either gnome or kde?
it has to do with how much they assume you know how to do yourself
Okay, but basically the user experience is the same, except that some will use aptitude and some pacman etcetc
cl3: some require more command line knowledge for ease of use, others provide gui interfaces to make it easier
is was using apt-get to install snort and my system froze, I rebooted and put the command in again and got this: http://pastebin.ca/1681423 Anyone know how to fix it?
